title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 06 March 2017 - XWiki
content:
<OSIMasson1> has joined #xwiki  
07:39 <zgi> has joined #xwiki  
07:40 <zgi> can somebody help me please with an apache error? :-)  
07:56 <OSIMasson1> has quit  
08:13 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:06 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:25 <pulkit4tech> has joined #xwiki  
09:39 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
09:42 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
09:46 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:57 <vmassol> zgi: hi, please provide your error (pastebin, etc). Thanks  
09:58 <zgi> vmassol: http://pastebin.com/VpX8S5Tv  
10:00 <vmassol> root cause  
10:00 <vmassol> java.net.UnknownHostException: replacecontainer  
10:00 <zgi> so, what to do?  
10:00 <vmassol> this not a valid host name :)  
10:01 <zgi> it's wiki  
10:01 <vmassol> are you using the xwiki official docker image?  
10:01 <zgi> yapp  
10:01 <vmassol> let me try it but it's supposed to work  
10:01 <zgi> i hope so :-P :-P :-P  
10:02 <vmassol> you're using the instrcutions at https://hub.docker.com/\_/xwiki/ ?  
10:03 <vmassol> are you using "Using docker run"?  
10:04 <zgi> Using docker-compose  
10:05 <vmassol> ok trying  
10:07 <vmassol> zgi: you're using wget to get the compose file right?  
10:07 <vmassol> at https://raw.githubusercontent.com/xwiki-contrib/docker-xwiki/master/docker-compose-using.yml  
10:08 <vmassol> I'm asking since I see a mistake in the example given on the doc page  
10:12 <vmassol> zgi: I've followed the instructions, downloading the docker-compose-using.yml as indicated and it works fine  
10:12 <vmassol> with this command: wget -O docker-compose.yml https://raw.githubusercontent.com/xwiki-contrib/docker-xwiki/master/docker-compose-using.yml  
10:13 <zgi> i copy and pasted it ;-)  
10:13 <vmassol> ok so that's why  
10:13 <vmassol> it was missing the container names  
10:13 <vmassol> I've fixed it in the doc now  
10:13 <vmassol> here is the new version of the doc:  
10:13 <vmassol> https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/docker-xwiki  
10:13 <vmassol> notice:  
10:13 <vmassol> container\_name: xwiki  
10:13 <vmassol> and  
10:14 <vmassol> container\_name: xwiki-mysql  
10:14 <vmassol> this is what was missing  
10:14 <vmassol> I'm trying now with the compose in the doc  
10:16 <vmassol> yep works fine now  
10:17 <zgi> have it like that :-/  
10:18 <zgi> copy and pasted it again ... now composing  
10:21 <zgi> again :-/  
10:21 <vmassol> if it's not working, make sure you remove your container first  
10:22 <vmassol> note: you need to use  "docker-compose up --build" to take into account changes. But best is to remove the cotnainer  
10:30 <acotiuga> has quit  
10:30 <zgi> ok, rebuilding  
10:31 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <zgi> again :-/  
10:34 <vmassol> when you say "again", it means it's not working for you?  
10:34 <acotiuga1> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <vmassol> If so I suggest you clean everything and retry  
10:34 <vmassol> and download the compose file this time  
10:34 <vmassol> actually not sure why you need the compose file  
10:35 <vmassol> why don't you use "using docker run"?  
10:35 <acotiuga> has quit  
10:36 <vmassol> in any case both methods should work fine since I've just tested them  
10:36 <vmassol> (after cleaning up my docker install)  
10:36 <vmassol> (with docker system prune + remove the images)  
10:48 <zgi> always the same message  
10:48 <zgi> to prune:  
10:48 <zgi> docker rm xwiki && docker rm xwiki-mysql  
10:48 <vmassol> the error is simple, it means you haven't specified a host name for the mysql container  
10:48 <zgi> right?  
10:48 <vmassol> do you use docker for something else?  
10:49 <vmassol> if not, do a "docker system prune"  
10:49 <vmassol> no  
10:49 <vmassol> what you've mentiopned is not enough  
10:49 <vmassol> it won't remove the volumes  
10:49 <zgi> ok, again ...  
10:49 <vmassol> note that this is not related to xwik  
10:50 <vmassol> \*xwiki  
10:50 <vmassol> it's docker stuff  
10:50 <vmassol> you're not lucky you've chosen the worse options ;)  
10:50 <zgi> i know ... never worked with docker before ;-)  
10:50 <vmassol> 1) you've not used docker run which is the recommended approach  
10:50 <zgi> btw: can i use the docker version for production?  
10:50 <vmassol> 2) you've use the sample extract that needs to be adapted  
10:51 <vmassol> instead of the provide fumm docker compose file  
10:51 <vmassol> \*full  
10:51 <vmassol> re production I don't know YMMV  
10:51 <vmassol> some people use docker in prod  
10:51 <vmassol> others don't  
10:51 <vmassol> I've never had the opportunity to try it in prod so I can't help  
10:51 <vmassol> but theoretically yes it can be used  
10:51 <zgi> ok ;-)  
10:52 <vmassol> but don't use docker-compose  
10:52 <vmassol> since you'll not map the voulmes easily with that  
10:52 <zgi> so there are no security issues or sth else  
10:52 <vmassol> (you don't control their locations)  
10:52 <vmassol> not sure what you mean  
10:53 <vmassol> you need to run xwiki on an OS  
10:53 <vmassol> whether this os is inside docker or not will have the same flaws related to this os AFAIK  
10:53 <zgi> i don't care about location since its a separate vm only for xwiki ;-)  
10:53 <vmassol> you do  
10:53 <vmassol> if you run in prod you need to hande backups  
10:53 <zgi> shure  
10:53 <vmassol> you mean you save the whole VM?  
10:54 <vmassol> (for the backups)  
10:54 <vmassol> well you still do want to manage the volumes  
10:54 <vmassol> since there are maintenance operations that requires you to go there  
10:54 <vmassol> for ex, when the solr schema changes you need to remove the solr directory before restarting xwiki  
10:54 <vmassol> (just to give one example)  
10:55 <vmassol> you may also need to run mysql commands  from time to time  
10:55 <vmassol> to set up some indexes, etc  
10:55 <vmassol> anyway this is standard docker stuff  
10:55 <vmassol> that you'll need to read about  
10:56 <zgi> ummmm ... ok ^^  
10:56 <vmassol> for production my recommendation would be to use apt (http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationViaAPT)  
10:59 <zgi> is working :-) :-) :-)  
10:59 <zgi> THANK YOU!!!!!!! :-)  
11:02 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:05 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:08 <vmassol> cool  
11:10 <zgi> so, how to autostart that?  
11:12 <vmassol> don't know, docker has some restart flag I think  
11:12 <vmassol> https://docs.docker.com/engine/admin/host\_integration/  
11:13 <vmassol> (never used that, I've just gooled it)  
11:13 <vmassol> \*googled  
11:16 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
12:10 <vmassol> recreating playground  
12:14 <edvorg> has quit  
12:16 <vmassol> the good news is that recreating playground doesn't crash the wiki anymore ;)  
12:26 <acotiuga1> has quit  
12:30 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> has joined #xwiki  
12:30 <vmassol> evalica: could you re-check playground.xwiki.org?  
12:31 <vmassol> normally playground should be good again  
12:32 <vmassol> let's hope it'll be ok tomorrow morning  
12:33 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> has quit

15:26 <pulkit4tech> has joined #xwiki

16:01 <sgc\_072> Hi all. I am new here and want to contribute to the organisation. Can anyone get me started? I am good at HTML, CSS, JAVASCRIPT, C and know about basics of Java.  
16:04 <tmortagne1> sgc\_072: Hi, you might want to look at http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/Guidelines#HIncreasingyourchancesofbeingacceptedasastudent there is a few links and idea in there  
16:05 <sgc\_072> tmortagne1: Thanks, I will look to this. :D  
16:06 <tmortagne1> sgc\_072: you're welcome :)  
16:35 <pulkit4tech> has quit
